citing_paper_authors: Jason S., Chang | J. N., Chen
raw_text: Those relations between the sense and its defining words are reflected in semantic dusters that are termed categorical, functional, and situational clusters in McRoy (1992)
clean_text: Those relations between the sense and its defining words are reflected in semantic dusters that are termed categorical, functional, and situational clusters in McRoy (1992).

citing_paper_authors: Jason S., Chang | J. N., Chen
raw_text: Moreover, those relations have been shown to be very effective knowledge sources for WSD (McRoy 1992) and interpretation f noun sequences (Vanderwende 1994)
clean_text: Moreover, those relations have been shown to be very effective knowledge sources for WSD (McRoy 1992) and interpretation of noun sequences (Vanderwende 1994).

citing_paper_authors: German, Rigau | Jordi, Atserias | Eneko, Agirre
raw_text: Even if most of the techniques for WSD are presented as stand-alone, it is our belief, following the ideas of (McRoy, 1992), that full-fledged lexical ambiguity resolution should combine several information sources and techniques
clean_text: Even if most of the techniques for WSD are presented as stand-alone, it is our belief, following the ideas of (McRoy, 1992), that full-fledged lexical ambiguity resolution should combine several information sources and techniques.

raw_text: There are also hybrid methods that combine several sources of knowledge such as lexicon information, heuristics, collocations and others (McRoy, 1992) (Bruce and Wiebe, 1994) (Ng and Lee, 1996) (Rigau, Asterias et al, 1997)

However, both (Peder sen, 2001a) and (Lee and Ng, 2002) suggest that different learning algorithms result in little change in overall disambiguation results, and that the real determiner of accuracy is the set of features that are employed. Previous work has shown that using different combinations of features is advantageous for word sense disambiguation (e.g., (McRoy, 1992), (Ng and Lee, 1996), (Stevenson and Wilks, 2001), (Yarowsky and Florian, 2002))
(McRoy, 1992) was one of the first to use multiple kinds of features for word sense disambiguation in the semantic interpretation system, TRUMP
clean_text: (McRoy, 1992) was one of the first to use multiple kinds of features for word sense disambiguation in the semantic interpretation system, TRUMP.

raw_text: Prior research (e.g., (McRoy, 1992), (Ng and Lee, 1996), (Stevenson and Wilks, 2001), (Yarowsky and Florian, 2002)) suggests that use of both syntactic and lexical features will improve disambiguation accuracies
Further, some of the work (e.g., (McRoy, 1992), (Ng and Lee, 1996)) suggests that using both kinds of features may result in significantly higher accuracies as compared to individual results

citing_paper_authors: You-Jin, Chung | Sin-Jae, Kang | Kyonghi, Moon | Jong-Hyeok, Lee
raw_text: These include surrounding words (an unordered set of words surrounding a target word), local collocations (a short sequence of words near a target word, taking word order into account), syntactic relations (selectional restrictions), parts of speech, morphological forms, etc (McRoy, 1992, Ng and Zelle, 1997)
Recent examples of this work include (Bruce and Guthrie, 1992), (Bruce and Wiebe, 1994), (McRoy, 1992)

We propose a tagger that makes use of several types of information (dictionary definitions, parts-of-speech, domain codes, selectional preferences and collocates) in the tradition of McRoy (McRoy, 1992) although, the information sources we use are orthogonal, unlike the sources he used, making it easier to evaluate the performance of the various modules
clean_text: We propose a tagger that makes use of several types of information (dictionary definitions, parts-of-speech, domain codes, selectional preferences and collocates) in the tradition of McRoy (McRoy, 1992) although, the information sources we use are orthogonal, unlike the sources he used, making it easier to evaluate the performance of the various modules.

raw_text: This approach as been recently used by (McRoy, 1992) and (Mahesh and Beale, 1996)
clean_text: This approach as been recently used by (McRoy, 1992) and (Mahesh and Beale, 1996).

citing_paper_authors: Hajime, Mochizuki | Takeo, Honda | Manabu, Okumura
raw_text: There are a variety of methods for combining multiple knowledge sources (linguistic ues) (McRoy, 1992)
clean_text: There are a variety of methods for combining multiple knowledge sources (linguistic cues) (McRoy, 1992).

raw_text: McRoy (1992) describes a study of different sources useful for word sense disambiguation, including morphological information
clean_text: McRoy (1992) describes a study of different sources useful for word sense disambiguation, including morphological information.
